titles: Further obseruations of the English Spanish pilgrime, concerning Spaine being a second part of his former booke, and containing these particulars: the description of a famous monastery, or house of the King of Spaines, called the Escuriall, not the like in the Christian world: a briefe relation of certaine d√¶monicall stratagems of the Spanish Inquisition exercised on diuers English men of note of late times, and now liuing in England. A relation of the founding of a military order in Rome, to wit, of the immaculate Conception of our Lady, the blessed Virgin. Composed by Iames Wadsworth, Gentleman, lately conuerted into his true mothers bosome, the Church of England, and heretofore pentioner to the King of Spaine.
author: Wadsworth, James, 1604-1656?
Wadsworth, James, 1604-1656? English Spanish pilgrime. aut
publisher: Imprinted by Felix Kyngston for Nathaniel Butter, and are to be sold at his shop at S. Austens gate at the signe of the pide Bull,
notes: Running title reads: Further obseruations of the English Spanish pilgrime, &c.
A variant of the edition with imprint giving Robert Allot as publisher.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Catholic Church --  Controversial literature --  Early works to 1800.
